PingTalk

Continuous Adaptive Trust: The Final Frontier of the Trust Revolution | Ping Identity

Since the term ‚ÄòZero Trust‚Äô was coined back in 2010, Zero Trust has become the de facto cybersecurity industry paradigm. And for good reason - understanding security broadly through the lens of trust in users ultimately better protects your organization‚Äôs resources.   But Zero Trust is a journey: one that hinges upon how well you can truly evaluate trust in a user when handling their acce

Since the term ‚ÄòZero Trust‚Äô was coined back in 2010, Zero Trust has become the de facto cybersecurity industry paradigm. And for good reason - understanding security broadly through the lens of trust in users ultimately better protects your organization‚Äôs resources.

 

But Zero Trust is a journey: one that hinges upon how well you can truly evaluate trust in a user when handling their access requests day in and day out. Continuous Adaptive Trust is the key step to achieving Zero Trust Architecture. Moving to a model of Continuous Adaptive Trust, one where trust in users is repeatedly evaluated and reevaluated, is worth striving for in the journey towards Zero Trust with best-defined trust with users for user protection.

Mike shares insights for smaller organizations and highlights the impact of geopolitics and AI on c

Unlocking the power of AI and data trust 31 Oct 2023 trudy 30 September 2023 - 10:46 257 Strawinskylaan 1077 XX Amsterdam 52.340602470577, 4.8737841

13:00 • 12 days ago

Ocean Protocol

Announcing the Winners of ‚ÄòThe NFL Fantasy Football‚Äô Data Challenge

This data challenge took NFL player performance data and fantasy points from the last 6 seasons to calculate forecasted points to be scored in the 2024 NFL season that began Sept. 7, 2023. AI / ML offers tools to give a competitive edge in predictive analytics, business intelligence, and performance metrics. Fantasy Football is a popular pastime for a large amount of the world, we gathered d
This data challenge took NFL player performance data and fantasy points from the last 6 seasons to calculate forecasted points to be scored in the 2024 NFL season that began Sept. 7, 2023.

AI / ML offers tools to give a competitive edge in predictive analytics, business intelligence, and performance metrics. Fantasy Football is a popular pastime for a large amount of the world, we gathered data around the past 6 seasons of player performance data to see what our community of data scientists could create.

The task at hand was the following:

Conduct EDA (Exploratory Data Analysis) Implement Feature Engineering Build a Model to predict next season‚Äôs scores Evaluate the Model‚Äôs performance in metrics like RMSE, MAE (Mean Absolute Error) Submit a Final Prediction Winners

The winning reports are available to download in the Ocean Market and are summarized below:

1st place ($2500): Mohammad Jamali

Report + Prediction is available for download via: https://market.oceanprotocol.com/asset/did:op:79219d53c70e285c0ad607fa71fadcc170491f972220de91747520c71416daa4

Mohammad took gold in this challenge to predict the scores of NFL players in fantasy football. This report took the data set provided in the challenge, as well as external data feeds and alternative sources. In the link above, you will find great detail in data visualization, script explanation, use of neural networks, and several different iterations of predictive analytics for each category of NFL player.

2nd Place ($1500): Goblin

This report is available for download via: https://market.oceanprotocol.com/asset/did:op:3d642c18c5d3e044a2b9c501af7b5bb91f0258e48f22c9eaaa63f464bc51b803

Prediction dataset: https://market.oceanprotocol.com/asset/did:op:f38ec66f009d8ff88f8a10d394d38804da3d51bc5610ae6b21166547e50f7f2f

Goblin‚Äôs report differentiated from others off the bat by immediately identifying missing values in the dataset provided for this challenge. The predictions above include value factors of players' years of experience, age, BMI, and team to influence the task of predicting player performance scores. Another advantage this report gives is yearly positional averages for the dominant point scorers on a given fantasy team (Quarterback, Running Backs, Wide receivers) which supports the prediction report seen above for download. Due to this approach, Goblin was able to detect a quantifiable difference between mobile and pocket quarterbacks, dual-threat running backs, and versatile wide receivers.

3rd Place ($100): Goat

Report: https://market.oceanprotocol.com/asset/did:op:efa3dc4a52022d75f8dec153e1f63a2537ff49b72af1ab8f00b0bd6819f4e5ab

Predictions:

https://market.oceanprotocol.com/asset/did:op:c65bb5e735e670f63b100b1c26844b335f6b8f105a07358de505d81be87f62e6

The visuals above shows 2 key metrics:

1) Distribution of Fantasy Points Per Game: The majority of players score fewer fantasy points per game, with a peak around 0‚Äì5 points. There‚Äôs a long tail, indicating that only a few players score exceptionally high points per game.

2) Player Experience (Age) vs. Fantasy Points Per Game: There‚Äôs no clear linear relationship between age and fantasy points per game. However, we do see a wide distribution of points across all age groups, with younger players (around age 25) having some of the highest scores.

Goat displayed fascinating feature engineering in this data challenge and chose to base the predictive analytics model on the following attributes:

completions_per_game and attempts_per_game

passing_yards_per_game

passing_tds_per_game

Interceptions_per_game

Passing_air_yards_per_game

passing_yards_after_catch_per_game (YAC)

Rushing_attempts_per_game

Rushing_yards_per_game

Rushing_tds_per_game

Receptions_per_game

Targets_per_game

Receiving_yards_per_game

Receiving_tds_per_game

Receiving_yards_after_catch_per_game

receiving_air_yards_per_game

For the performance of this model, initially, 5-fold cross-validation was performed on the data spanning from 2016 to 2022. This method was chosen to rigorously assess and fine-tune each model‚Äôs performance using a comprehensive range of hyperparameters. By leveraging cross-validation, we ensured the model‚Äôs assessment wasn‚Äôt reliant on a singular data split. Instead, it was evaluated across multiple subsets, bolstering the robustness and reliability of the resulting performance metrics.

The conclusions and predictions found in this report can be most beneficial to people who are looking for a competitive edge in their fantasy football league or player performance wagers.

Summary

This challenge showed a great experiment testing machine learning tactics applied to a real-world entertainment industry. Do you think other sports entertainment industries can benefit from predictive analytics brought through by a data challenge with Ocean Protocol?

Reach out to us in our discord #data-science-hub channel: https://discord.gg/yFRPH9PCN4

To see past, current, and future data challenges sponsored by Ocean, please visit https://oceanprotocol.com/earn/data-challenges

About Ocean Protocol

Ocean was founded to level the playing field for AI and data. Ocean tools enable people to privately & securely publish, exchange, and consume data.

Follow Ocean on Twitter or Telegram to keep up to date. Chat directly with the Ocean community on Discord. Or, track Ocean progress directly on GitHub.

Announcing the Winners of ‚ÄòThe NFL Fantasy Football‚Äô Data Challenge was originally published in Ocean Protocol on Medium, where people are continuing the conversation by highlighting and responding to this story.

IDENTOS

IDENTOS moves up the ranks on The Globe and Mail‚Äôs fifth-annual ranking of Canada‚Äôs Top Growing Companies

IDENTOS Inc. is pleased to announce it has placed #143 on the 2023 Report on Business ranking of Canada‚Äôs Top Growing Companies.Canada‚Äôs Top Growing Companies ranks Canadian companies on three-year revenue growth. IDENTOS earned its spot with three-year growth of 338%. IDENTOS is particularly proud to have moved up from its 2022 ranking in 330rd [‚Ä¶] The post IDENTOS moves up the ranks on The Glo

IDENTOS Inc. is pleased to announce it has placed #143 on the 2023 Report on Business ranking of Canada‚Äôs Top Growing Companies.

Canada‚Äôs Top Growing Companies ranks Canadian companies on three-year revenue growth. IDENTOS earned its spot with three-year growth of 338%. IDENTOS is particularly proud to have moved up from its 2022 ranking in 330rd place.

As a leading cloud software solution provider with specialized healthcare expertise in digital identity, authorization, access, consent, and user experience, the company‚Äôs mission is to enable organizations to put patients and citizens in control of their data, reduce identity-based cyber risk, and ease data interoperability for all stakeholders.  The company‚Äôs growth can be attributed to its agility and learning culture focused on employees and customers. 

With nearly every industry facing demands for better access and stronger data security, IDENTOS provides an ideal solution by combining even the most complex data integrations with simple, easy-to-use interfaces and accessibility tools to help make everyone‚Äôs digital journey a little easier.

For healthcare customers, IDENTOS simplifies end users digital healthcare journeys and reduces cyber risk. The acceleration in digital health services and fragmentation only increased the demand for its managed services.  IDENTOS provides a safer way for citizens, patients and providers to securely and safely access and consent to, when and where they choose, the sharing of relevant information across the digital health ecosystem. 

‚ÄúWe‚Äôve been incredibly fortunate to embark on numerous projects, collaborate with outstanding customers, and benefit from the dedication of our exceptionally skilled team members, which has led to our inclusion in The Globe & Mail‚Äôs Canada‚Äôs Top Growing Companies ranking. We‚Äôre thrilled to leverage this momentum as we remain steadfast in our pursuit of excellence in delivering top-tier identity and access management solutions. Here‚Äôs to the exciting journey that lies ahead over the next three years!‚Äù ‚ÄìMike Cook, CEO, IDENTOS Inc.

Canada‚Äôs Top Growing Companies is an editorial ranking that was launched in 2019. It aims to bring the accomplishments of innovative businesses in Canada to the forefront. In order to qualify for this voluntary program; companies had to complete an in-depth application process and fulfill requirements. In total, 425 companies earned a spot on this year‚Äôs ranking. 

The full list of 2023 winners along with editorial coverage is published in the October issue of Report on Business magazine. The list is out now and online here. 

‚ÄúCanada‚Äôs Top Growing Companies acknowledges the drive and ingenuity displayed by Canadian business,‚Äù says Dawn Calleja, Editor of Report on Business magazine. ‚ÄúThis year‚Äôs ranking serves as an inspiration for future business owners.‚Äù 

‚ÄúThis year‚Äôs Report on Business magazine‚Äôs list of Top Growing Companies shows how innovative ideas always rise to the top, perhaps even more so in times of uncertainty,‚Äù says Andrew Saunders, CEO of The Globe and Mail. ‚ÄúThe Globe and Mail congratulates this year‚Äôs winners for meeting and surpassing those economic challenges.‚Äù

(source: Globe & Mail‚Äôs Report on Business)

Tokeny Solutions

Tokeny‚Äôs Talent | Ali

The post Tokeny‚Äôs Talent | Ali appeared first on Tokeny.
Ali Naci Arbak is a Senior Software Developer at Tokeny.  Tell us about yourself!

I‚Äôm Ali. I was born in 1997 and currently reside in Istanbul, where I work as a software developer at Tokeny. My journey into programming began during my primary school years when I aspired to create my own game modes. Determining my career path at a young age made things easier. As I entered high school, I made the decision to fully commit to programming, kickstarting my career with freelance projects. Since then, I have worked in various domains and technologies, and my ongoing journey has now led me to blockchain.

What were you doing before Tokeny and what inspired you to join the team?

A few years ago, I had no experience with blockchain, but some friends and I decided to start a project using blockchain technology. We began developing smart contracts, and I became really interested in it. That‚Äôs when I decided to explore opportunities in this field and started researching blockchain companies. My main criteria were finding a company that was solving real-world problems with meaningful products. Tokenization is crucial in bringing blockchain to the financial industry, and Tokeny is a leader in providing the technology for it. It seemed like a perfect fit for me üòä.

How would you describe working at Tokeny?

One thing that stood out to me during the interviews was that everyone was sincere and clear. I didn‚Äôt hear any empty buzzwords, which I appreciated. Now that I am an employee, my experience with internal communication has been just as good. We‚Äôre a team that works well together, and it‚Äôs easy to reach out to anyone for help when needed.

Our product is based on cutting-edge technology, so there‚Äôs a lot of room for learning and self-improvement. On top of that, since blockchain is a field that‚Äôs always evolving, we have the chance to help shape industry standards. We‚Äôve already made progress with the ERC-3643 protocol, and I believe we‚Äôll achieve even more with ONCHAINID and the new solutions we‚Äôre developing. It‚Äôs truly exciting to be a part of all this.

What is your ultimate dream?

My ultimate dream is that people can work when they want, where they want, and how much they want, rather than working out of necessity. They should have the time and freedom to pursue their personal goals and fulfillment. This dream may not be a reality today, but with the progress of artificial intelligence and automation, it might be achievable in the future, perhaps a century from now. Of course, this depends on how well we distribute resources fairly and justly.

When the technical limitations are no longer an issue, and human labor in production becomes less necessary, I‚Äôd like to see where humanity goes.

What gets you excited about Tokeny‚Äôs future?

What excites me about Tokeny‚Äôs future is the potential of tokenization to become increasingly prevalent in financial markets and everyday life as time goes on. Having entered the industry during its early stages and contributed to solutions, I believe that we can play a crucial role in this development and make significant contributions to the adoption of blockchain in the industry. Being a part of a company with the potential to become a unicorn is just a bonus! üòä

In the high-stakes world of financial institutions, safeguarding sensitive data is paramount. The enemy, however, may lurk within. Join us for an eye-opening webinar as we delve deep into the world of insider threats, their definitions, types, and most importantly, how to protect your institution from them. Tokeny Solutions

Introducing WalletConnect V2: Discover the New Upgrades

The post Introducing WalletConnect V2: Discover the New Upgrades appeared first on Tokeny.

Product Focus

Introducing WalletConnect V2: Discover the New Upgrades

This content is taken from the monthly Product Focus newsletter in September 2023.

At Tokeny, we‚Äôre firm believers that accelerating mass adoption doesn‚Äôt mean drowning issuers and users in the complexities of blockchain. It‚Äôs about offering a user-friendly experience that mirrors the platforms and interfaces they already know.

With this in mind, we‚Äôve integrated blockchain wallets in a way that‚Äôs transparent to the end user. Moreover, we‚Äôre thrilled to support connections to third-party protocols, like WalletConnect, opening doors to a broader spectrum of blockchain applications.

For those new to it, WalletConnect is a protocol enabling users to link their blockchain wallets to decentralized applications (DApps) via a straightforward QR code scan ‚Äî all without exposing their private keys.

With protocols like WalletConnect, Tokeny‚Äôs platform readies and verifies the blockchain transaction, then forwards the prepped transaction to the selected wallet provider. This allows customers to review and authorize it.

Here‚Äôs a practical guide for clarity:

Background context: Investor 1 has invested in company X and stores their shares in a self-custody wallet on their computer. MetaMask is an example of a popular wallet.

Step 1: The investor holds their shares in their self-custody wallet that is connected to Tokeny‚Äôs platform

Step 2: The investor is seeking liquidity and sees that a certain decentralized exchange is an eligible platform to sell/swap their shares

Step 3: The investor goes to the decentralized exhange‚Äôs website, receives the QR code then scans the QR code directly from Tokeny which creates a secure ‚Äòbridge‚Äô between Tokeny and the decentralized exchange

Step 4: Once the secure connection is established, the investor is prompted to confirm the transaction details on their self-custody wallet, ensuring that the correct amount and share type are being transacted

Step 5: After verifying the transaction details, the investor confirms the sale or swap on their wallet

Step 6: The decentralized exchange processes the transaction, updating both the exchange‚Äôs ledger and Tokeny‚Äôs platform to reflect the new status of the investor‚Äôs shares

Here is a visual representation of what it could look like:

Excitingly, WalletConnect‚Äôs team has elevated the experience even further. They‚Äôve recently launched V2, and we‚Äôre elated to declare our successful migration, making the new updates accessible for everyone.

Here‚Äôs a glimpse into V2‚Äôs enhanced offerings:

Multi-Chain Support: Embracing all EVM-compatible blockchains and more Increased Session Duration Times: Enhance stability with prolonged session durations, minimizing disconnections Improved User Experience: While the interface‚Äôs visuals remain consistent, users will notice a swifter, more dependable, and streamlined experience

With these upgrades, our users and investors can seamlessly connect to a wide range of supported blockchain applications using WalletConnect, all directly from their self-custody wallet.

We continuously refine our tech stack and integrations to provide an unparalleled tokenization platform for the future of finance to ultimately benefit all of our users.

Thank you for staying updated with us. Looking forward to next month‚Äôs edition!

Subscribe Newsletter

This monthly Product Focus newsletter is designed to give you insider knowledge about the development of our products. Fill out the form below to subscribe to the newsletter.

Exciting News! Introducing Our Recognition Program

Announcing a monthly celebration of our community members üíõ

Today we unveil something special - our very own Recognition Program! ‚ú®

üí≠ What's this all about?‚Äã

This program is our way of expressing our deepest gratitude to each and every one of you. We know that our community thrives because of your dedication and contributions, and it's high time we recognize your amazing efforts.

üèÜ The Categories‚Äã

We've carefully crafted six categories to celebrate different aspects of our community:

Feedback Champion Award üì£: This category honors the individuals who provide invaluable feedback, helping us improve and grow. Content Creator Award üé•: Recognizing the creative minds who share their knowledge through content creation, whether it's articles, videos, or other forms of media. Community Hero Award ü¶∏: For those who go above and beyond to support and uplift fellow community members. Rising Star Award üåü: Celebrating the newcomers who have made a significant impact in a short amount of time. New Contributor Award üÜï: Acknowledging those who have recently joined us and made their first contributions. Docs Wizard Award üìñ: Highlighting the experts who excel in documentation, making our resources more accessible and helpful. üéÅ The Rewards‚Äã

Each category winner will receive gift cards to our TBD swag shop, where they can choose up to 2 items of their liking. It's our small way of saying THANK YOU for your outstanding contributions.

Not only that, the winners will also be prominently featured on our website's community landing page for everyone to see and celebrate their achievements! üåü

üóì Announcement Schedule‚Äã

For September, to kick us off, winners in each category will be announced on Monday 10/2nd. Each category will have one winner.

Starting from October, there may be more than one winner in each category, and the category names can change upon community request.

You can nominate winners for each category during our monthly dedicated Discord thread, held on the second-to-last Friday of every month. Mark your calendars for October's nominations on 10/20th in our #general channel! üóìÔ∏èüë•

ü§ó Community Involvement‚Äã

Our community is at the heart of everything we do, and we value your input. This Recognition Program is a collaborative effort, and you have a say in how it evolves. Categories can change based on community feedback, and we encourage you to actively participate in shaping this program.

This is just the beginning, and we can't wait to kick off this journey with you all. Together, let's make our community even more vibrant and supportive than ever before.

Let the Recognition Program commence! ü•≥ #RecognitionProgram #CommunityAppreciation

Stay tuned! Who do you think our September recognition winners are going to be? ü§î

KuppingerCole

Innovation Never Rests - a New SOC Blueprint for Tomorrow's Threats

Join security experts at KuppingerCole Analysts and CrowdStrike as they discuss why SOCs typically struggle to be more proactive, explore what is required to build a flexible, scalable and automated SOC, and explain the role of ML, LLMs and other forms of AI in extending the capabilities of the SOC. Warwick Ashford, Senior Analyst at KuppingerCole Analysts, will outline the challenges facing cyb

Join security experts at KuppingerCole Analysts and CrowdStrike as they discuss why SOCs typically struggle to be more proactive, explore what is required to build a flexible, scalable and automated SOC, and explain the role of ML, LLMs and other forms of AI in extending the capabilities of the SOC.

Warwick Ashford, Senior Analyst at KuppingerCole Analysts, will outline the challenges facing cybersecurity teams, why traditional approaches to building SOCs need to change, and why automation and human-machine collaboration is the key to meet security and business needs.

Aris Koios, Technology Strategist, DACH, at CrowdStrike will explain how to measure success beyond activity driven metrics, why it is important to use open standards and API-driven approaches, and how to supercharge detection and response with a single, unified SOC tech stack.


Attend this webinar to:

Understand the challenges being faced by modern SOCs. Learn why traditional SOCs are no longer fit for purpose. Discover the benefits of a flexible, scalable and automated SOC Find out how SOCs can benefit from the use of AI technology. See how a unified SOC tech stack can boost enterprise detection and response.

22:00 • 13 days ago

YeshID

Right-sized onboarding and offboarding free for the first 100 signups

This summer, we kicked off the beta program for YeshID, the all-in-one identity management tool for growing organizations. We invited participants to help us build the future of identity, access,... The post Right-sized onboarding and offboarding free for the first 100 signups appeared first on YeshID.

This summer, we kicked off the beta program for YeshID, the all-in-one identity management tool for growing organizations. We invited participants to help us build the future of identity, access, and application management for small- and medium-sized businesses. But there was a catch ‚Äî you had to talk with us. We realized this was a bump in the process and potentially scary because you might think we were going to sell something to you.

We‚Äôve onboarded more than 20 companies to the beta, ranging from faith-based nonprofits to financial technology companies. The only stipulation to join is that they run on Google Workspace and have fewer than 250 employees. Our beta members do vastly different things and are different sizes, but we‚Äôve discovered that they all have three things in common:

The people who are running Google Workspace access to the apps their companies use are strapped, and this isn‚Äôt their only responsibility. We‚Äôve found they‚Äôre split into two camps. There‚Äôs the one-person IT team that‚Äôs bogged down with a million and one tasks. Or there‚Äôs someone (like me at my company!) who just got saddled with the task because someone has to do it. The biggest obstacle these folks currently face is onboarding/offboarding. Solutions are either too rudimentary, like tracking data in a spreadsheet, or too advanced, like biting off more than you need with Okta. There‚Äôs no good middle ground, and these IT teams of one, or Unexpected Google Admins, as we like to call them, are left to figure it all out on their own.  Everyone we‚Äôve talked to so far has said they need the same things out of their onboarding and offboarding tool: They need to be able to get people to work ASAP, they need a smart process default for setting up access, and they need it to be available at a low cost or for free. 

With the needs around onboarding and offboarding being so great (and purse strings being so tight), we‚Äôve decided to offer Onboard, our beta onboarding and offboarding functionality, for free to the first 100 customers who join the beta. And now you don‚Äôt even need to talk to us. You can simply sign up and get immediate access. 

The Goldilocks of onboarding and offboarding

Running a startup ourselves, we understand the need to get employees started yesterday because the team is lean and we need those hands. We want to save ourselves time and money, too, because those are two things any business leader is short on. 

It‚Äôs true that there are other options in this space: GAM, Bettercloud, Okta, and Ping, to name a few. The problem though is that for most small businesses, these products are overkill. They are expensive and time-consuming to implement ‚Äî especially when what you really need is just to get people to work using solid best practices, not advanced technology. 

YeshID Onboard provides an option for smaller companies that have embarked on their identity and access management journeys but aren‚Äôt in a place yet where they need a very technical (or expensive) solution. We provide a quick and easy way to accomplish your checklist today while setting up the foundational best practices that will help you grow in the future.

Especially when it comes to ‚Äúbirthright apps,‚Äù or those that are automatically granted to every new employee (think: Slack, Zoom, etc.), YeshID helps you save tons of time. 

Templatize and schedule onboarding and offboarding tasks to set up a repeatable process for ease and speed. Assign application administrator(s) then automatically route requests for provisioning to the proper owners. Track provisioning/de-provisioning in a single dashboard to offboard a user with confidence while maintaining compliance and reducing license costs. Empower employees to initiate requests for new application access that are automatically routed to the proper application administrator. Let‚Äôs grow together

Onboarding and offboarding are so fundamental to companies of all kinds, yet solutions have either lagged behind business needs or leap-frogged over a whole market size. This feels like the perfect entry point for YeshID and for companies looking to take the next step in their identity and access management journey. 

So get Onboard! The first 100 people to join will get access to better onboarding and offboarding for free today and early access to future product updates. And you‚Äôll be helping us learn even more about the small business needs that have been overlooked until now.

The post Right-sized onboarding and offboarding free for the first 100 signups appeared first on YeshID.

18:18 • 13 days ago

1Kosmos BlockID

Identity Based Authentication: The Key to Preventing Future MGM-Style Attacks

Join Rob MacDonald, VP of Product Marketing, and Mike Engle, Co-founder of 1Kosmos, as they discuss the recent cyber attack on MGM and explore the world of vishing (voice phishing) in this informative vlog. Discover how organizations can enhance their cybersecurity practices to prevent such incidents and learn about the importance of knowing who‚Äôs behind ‚Ä¶ Continued The post Identity Based Authe

Join Rob MacDonald, VP of Product Marketing, and Mike Engle, Co-founder of 1Kosmos, as they discuss the recent cyber attack on MGM and explore the world of vishing (voice phishing) in this informative vlog. Discover how organizations can enhance their cybersecurity practices to prevent such incidents and learn about the importance of knowing who‚Äôs behind the device. Stay informed and stay secure with insights from the experts at 1Kosmos.

Rob MacDonald:
Hi everyone. Welcome to our latest vlog. My name is Rob MacDonald. I‚Äôm vice president of product marketing here at 1Kosmos, and I‚Äôm joined today by Mike Engle. Mike, how are you doing?

Mike Engle:
Doing great. Thanks for having me, Rob. I‚Äôm a co-founder here at 1Kosmos, and excited to be here on this Friday afternoon.

Rob MacDonald:
Listen, it‚Äôs always good to sit down and chat with you. Today, we‚Äôre going to talk a little bit about the latest cyber attack that we‚Äôve seen come across the newswire this week. MGM, I think being part of the high-tech world, we‚Äôve all been to Vegas for various different events. I know that I‚Äôve stayed in a couple of MGM resorts. Mike, why don‚Äôt you tell us a little bit about your initial thoughts on it and explain what happened?

Mike Engle:
Well, sadly, this has happened countless times over the past couple of years. This one was a bad actor getting in through the front door by coercing some type of help desk to give out a credential. The rumor has it that the bad guy found out about employee information on LinkedIn. You‚Äôre Robert MacDonald, you work at 1Kosmos, and then use that information to engage with the help desk to figure out how to trick the help desk into giving them something they shouldn‚Äôt have.

Rob MacDonald:
I think the hack is something referred to as vishing.

Mike Engle:
Right.

Rob MacDonald:
You‚Äôve touched, just kind of quickly on that just now. Why don‚Äôt you tell us a little bit about what vishing is and the concept behind that, and why it‚Äôs become so significant in terms of a cybersecurity threat over the last little while?

Mike Engle:
There‚Äôs a couple of ishings out there.

Rob MacDonald:
Lots of ishings.

Mike Engle:
I think we all know phishing very well because we‚Äôve been using email for so long. That‚Äôs P-H-I-S-H-I-N-G, right? Well, vishing is using your voice, using a phone call or voiceover IP call to reach out to somebody and pull information from them or convince them to do something. So it‚Äôs similar. In emails, you get an email. You‚Äôre tricked into clicking a link or changing a routing number. It‚Äôs really a similar concept, just a different medium. There‚Äôs other terms for SMS phishing, I think that‚Äôs called smishing or‚Ä¶ I can‚Äôt keep up with all the issues, but they‚Äôre all the same basic principle.

Rob MacDonald:
All fun terms, just they have pretty serious consequences behind them. Listen, MGM‚Äôs not a small organization, they‚Äôre worth billions with a B. Do you find it surprising, and again, not to pick on MGM, but do you find it surprising something like this happened and that they were vulnerable to an attack such as this?

Mike Engle:
It‚Äôs surprising that they got impacted as badly as they did. I‚Äôm not surprised that it happened because people are fallible. It‚Äôs just things are going to happen. Could I accidentally leave my super trusted authenticator and something sitting somewhere by accident? Of course. You could leave the bank vault open by mistake. But what surprised me is that it took them, I think it was 12 days to get back in operational, and that‚Äôs, I don‚Äôt know, some serious business continuity challenges that they had there, so that part is really surprising.

Rob MacDonald:
What did they need to do to get back online? I‚Äôm assuming there was ransomware or something along those lines. Can you tell me a little bit about what happened there and maybe what some of the consequences are?

Mike Engle:
I don‚Äôt have details. I just heard about 15 hours ago that they‚Äôre back to being pretty fully operational, so that‚Äôs in the 12th day or 10 plus days, and I didn‚Äôt hear that they paid the ransom. Caesars, on the other hand, paid double-digit millions of dollars to get their systems put back online. MGM must have decided not to do that, which you‚Äôre not supposed to, because it encourages the bad behavior.

But that means the bad guys locked up all of their data that made their systems not work and would not give it back. Now MGM was forced to go to probably backups or alternate data centers to try to get things back online, so that‚Äôs the recovery process that needs to happen.

Rob MacDonald:
That‚Äôs interesting because I think the Caesars happened on the very same day as the MGM one from what I can recall. Listen, how can organizations better prepare themselves against a social engineering attack like vishing or phishing or any of the other ishings in the future?

Mike Engle:
I mean, it‚Äôs really, a lot of it is user education, so there‚Äôs security awareness training and monitoring too. If you monitor those help desk calls and then the subsequent actions that happen. There‚Äôs all kinds of InfoSec things that companies typically do. You test your systems regularly, etc.

But one of the things that struck me about this is they said the organization did use multifactor authentication. Username, password, plus some type of one-time code, etc. and they bypassed that as well. There‚Äôs probably an opportunity to shore up that part of the vector and provide some options there that might be a little harder for bad guys to get their hands on.

Rob MacDonald:
For sure. Now, one of the things that pops up over your shoulder every now and again is, know who‚Äôs behind the device.

Mike Engle:
What? Really?

Rob MacDonald:
Yeah, I know.

Mike Engle:
Look at that.

Rob MacDonald:
Coincidentally. How could knowing who‚Äôs behind the device help companies like MGM prevent these types of attacks?

Mike Engle:
It sounds so simple. Know who it is, but digitally, that‚Äôs not easy to do, but something we‚Äôve gotten really good at here at 1Kosmos obviously. Flip the script a little bit. Bad actor calls the help desk says, ‚ÄúI‚Äôm Bob Smith,‚Äù and the help desk pushes a button that says, prove it. Not tell me about your first day of employment or the amount of your last direct deposit. All that stuff is stealable. Or fetch me this thing over there.

But what if they had to look into a camera and match Bob‚Äôs photo? Now you‚Äôve upped the game quite a bit. Bad actor in this case, sitting behind their computer in Eastern Europe or wherever it was they were. I don‚Äôt want to pick on Eastern Europe, I love the place. But now that‚Äôs a much harder attack. Now they have to do deep fakes, or there‚Äôs all kinds of other things that takes it to another level. That‚Äôs something that we‚Äôre seeing more companies have a lot of interest in, is a way to reach out and prove who it is that‚Äôs there.

Rob MacDonald:
Awesome. Again, not to pick on MGM or even Caesars for that matter, or any organization that runs into an issue like this because it is pretty serious. But what lessons can we take from this, that organizations or individuals can learn from what happened at MGM, for what happened at Caesars from a cyber attack standpoint to enhance their cybersecurity practices going forward?

Mike Engle:
First is always keep your resume current. I think understanding the gaps in the authentication controls and the reset password, reset controls are a big deal. I‚Äôll give you an example. What if my authenticator, which many people use mobiles, they‚Äôre very secure, but there‚Äôs ways now for the authentication data on here to replicate to my cloud, to iCloud or Google Cloud. If that happens, you‚Äôre exposing now the organization or whatever you‚Äôre logging into to the cloud security. It‚Äôs only as secure then as my Google Cloud password in that example.

There are some rumors that they might‚Äôve had that type of exposure. But in general, understanding that whole process of proving who you are to a help desk and ensuring that you truly know who is behind the device is one of the most important steps. Of course, training and business having really good backups and testing them regularly and stuff is other things that lots of other companies do as well.

Rob MacDonald:
Speaking of which, I have training I have to do today.

Mike Engle:
Yeah, get busy or you get yelled at.

Rob MacDonald:
For our own certification. Mike, I appreciate you coming by to tell us a little bit about the latest breach, and I look forward to having another vlog with you again sometime soon. Thanks everybody.

Mike Engle:
Let‚Äôs do that. Thank you very much.

The post Identity Based Authentication: The Key to Preventing Future MGM-Style Attacks appeared first on 1Kosmos.

16:34 • 13 days ago

Ocean Protocol

DF56 Completes and DF57 Launches

Stakers can claim DF56 rewards. DF57 runs Sep 28‚Ää‚Äî‚ÄäOct 5, 2023 1. Overview Data Farming Round 56 (DF56) has completed. 150K OCEAN was budgeted for rewards. Rewards counting started 12:01am Sep 21, 2023 and ended 12:01am Sep 28. You can claim rewards at the DF dapp Claim Portal. ‚ÄúDF Main is Here‚Äù is a self-contained description of DF. It‚Äôs up-to-date with weekly OCEAN budget allocation
Stakers can claim DF56 rewards. DF57 runs Sep 28‚Ää‚Äî‚ÄäOct 5, 2023 1. Overview

Data Farming Round 56 (DF56) has completed. 150K OCEAN was budgeted for rewards. Rewards counting started 12:01am Sep 21, 2023 and ended 12:01am Sep 28. You can claim rewards at the DF dapp Claim Portal.

‚ÄúDF Main is Here‚Äù is a self-contained description of DF. It‚Äôs up-to-date with weekly OCEAN budget allocations and how rewards are computed.

DF57 is live today, Sep 28. It concludes on Oct 05. 150K OCEAN is budgeted for rewards.

This post is organized as follows:

Section 2: DF structure Section 3: How to earn rewards, and claim them Section 4: Specific parameters for DF57 2. DF structure Passive DF. As a veOCEAN holder, you get passive rewards by default. Active DF has two substreams.
‚Äì Volume DF. Actively curate data by allocating veOCEAN towards data assets with high Data Consume Volume (DCV), to earn more.
‚Äì Challenge DF. Predict future ETH price; rewards are a function of prediction accuracy. 3. How to Earn Rewards, and Claim Them

There are three ways to earn and claim rewards: passive DF (like before), Active DF : Volume DF (like before), and Active DF : Challenge DF (new).

Passive DF. To earn: lock OCEAN for veOCEAN, via the DF webapp‚Äôs veOCEAN page. To claim: go to the DF Webapp‚Äôs Rewards page; within the ‚ÄúPassive Rewards‚Äù panel, click the ‚Äúclaim‚Äù button. Ocean docs has details. Active DF
‚Äì Volume DF substream. To earn: allocate veOCEAN towards data assets, via the DF webapp‚Äôs Volume DF page. To claim: go to the DF Webapp‚Äôs Rewards page; within the ‚ÄúActive Rewards‚Äù panel, click the ‚Äúclaim‚Äù button (it claims across all Active DF substreams at once). Ocean docs has details.
‚Äì Challenge DF substream. To earn: make ETH predictions for specific times; the next section gives an overview of how. To claim: go to the DF Webapp‚Äôs Rewards page; within the ‚ÄúActive Rewards‚Äù panel, click the ‚Äúclaim‚Äù button (it claims across all Active DF substreams at once). Challenge DF README has detailed instructions. 4. Specific Parameters for DF57

This round is part of DF Main, phase 1.

Budget. This round has 150,000 OCEAN rewards total. That OCEAN is allocated as follows.

Passive DF: 50% of rewards = 75,000 OCEAN Active DF: 50% of rewards
‚Äì Volume DF. All except what Challenge DF gets = 70,000 OCEAN
‚Äì Challenge DF. 5,000 OCEAN

Networks. Ocean currently supports five production networks: Ethereum Mainnet, Polygon, BSC, EWC, and Moonriver. DF applies to data on all of them.

Volume DF rewards are calculated as follows:

First, distribute OCEAN across each asset based on rank: highest-DCV asset gets most OCEAN, etc. Then, for each asset and each veOCEAN holder:
‚Äì If the holder is a publisher, 2x the effective stake
‚Äì Baseline rewards = (% stake in asset) * (OCEAN for asset)
‚Äì Bound rewards to the asset by 125% APY
‚Äì Bound rewards by asset‚Äôs DCV * 0.1%. This prevents wash consume.

Challenge DF rewards parameters:

Submission deadline: Wednesday at 23:59 UTC when the DF round finishes. Prediction at times: Thursday at 00:05 UTC, 00:10, ‚Ä¶, 1:00 (12 predictions total) The contestant with lowest error gets 2,500 OCEAN reward. 2nd-lowest gets 1,500 OCEAN. 3rd-lowest gets 1,000 OCEAN. Further parameters are in ‚ÄúIntroducing Challenge DF‚Äù blog post, and the Challenge DF README (linked from post).

Expect further evolution in Active DF: additional substreams, tuning substreams, and budget adjustments among substreams. What remains constant is passive DF, and total OCEAN rewards emission schedule.

Updates are always announced at the beginning of a round, if not sooner.

Appendix: Further Reading

The Data Farming Series post collects key articles and related resources about DF.

About Ocean Protocol

Ocean was founded to level the playing field for AI and data. Ocean tools enable people to privately & securely publish, exchange, and consume data.

Follow Ocean on Twitter or Telegram to keep up to date. Chat directly with the Ocean community on Discord. Or, track Ocean progress directly on GitHub.

DF56 Completes and DF57 Launches was originally published in Ocean Protocol on Medium, where people are continuing the conversation by highlighting and responding to this story.

La iniciativa pionera permitir√° a los ciudadanos reclamar la propiedad de sus documentos y datos personales y brindar mayor seguridad y privacidad. QuarkID, un protocolo de identidad digital de c√≥digo abierto (open source), utilizar√°... The post QuarkID se un
Extrimian y zkSync se asocian para llevar QuarkID y la identidad digital auto-soberana y descentralizada a los ciudadanos de Buenos Aires. La iniciativa pionera permitir√° a los ciudadanos reclamar la propiedad de sus documentos y datos personales y brindar mayor seguridad y privacidad. QuarkID, un protocolo de identidad digital de c√≥digo abierto (open source), utilizar√° zkSync Era para empoderar a los usuarios y garantizar la privacidad. La colaboraci√≥n establece a la Ciudad de Buenos Aires como l√≠der en la adopci√≥n de tecnolog√≠as blockchain para el beneficio de sus ciudadanos. El proyecto tiene como objetivo expandirse a nivel nacional, beneficiando a m√°s de 45 millones de personas en Argentina.

QuarkID  es el protocolo de Identidad Digital Descentralizado anclado en zkSync Era, desarrollado por Extrimian, e impulsado por el Gobierno de la Ciudad de Buenos Aires y otras empresas con gran experiencia en tecnolog√≠as descentralizadas, y seguridad de datos. Esta iniciativa busca poner el poder de los datos en manos de los ciudadanos.

El principal protocolo de Identidad Descentralizada de Am√©rica Latina se asocia con zkSync para transformar la Identidad Digital en la regi√≥n, empezando por la Ciudad de Buenos Aires.

En el siempre cambiante panorama de la tecnolog√≠a blockchain, la b√∫squeda de mil millones de usuarios sigue siendo un objetivo constante. Entonces, ¬øQu√© tecnolog√≠a o casos de uso deber√≠amos impulsar para lograr mayor adopci√≥n de la tecnolog√≠a Blockchain? 

Y es que, teniendo en cuenta las necesidades de privacidad y seguridad digital debido al incremento de cibercrimen y robo de identidad que est√° sucediendo en estos tiempos, un sistema de identidad y verificaci√≥n de datos privados que ponga al usuario en el centro, es imperioso.

En el coraz√≥n de la √©tica de Web3 se encuentra la soberan√≠a personal, un principio que se extiende mucho m√°s all√° de los activos financieros para abarcar aplicaciones m√°s amplias y pr√°cticas. Hoy, nos complace anunciar una iniciativa innovadora en esta direcci√≥n: la identidad digital de propiedad ciudadana. Buenos Aires, Argentina, est√° lista para liderar la carga, introduciendo gradualmente soluciones de identidad Web3 impulsadas por las propiedades centradas en la privacidad de zkSync Era.

En el esfuerzo por llevar las soluciones de identidad Web3 al escenario global, es imperativo que la privacidad siga siendo una preocupaci√≥n primordial en las tecnolog√≠as que permiten la propiedad de datos personales. Un mundo descentralizado que descuida las consideraciones de privacidad va en contra de la esencia misma de Web3.

Visualizamos un futuro en el que la libertad personal y la identidad digital aut√≥noma capaciten a las personas para administrar sus datos de manera segura.

Empoderando a los Ciudadanos de Buenos Aires con la Identidad Digital Descentralizada y Auto-Soberana.

Bajo la iniciativa de identificaci√≥n basada en blockchain de Argentina, los ciudadanos obtendr√°n el control sobre sus documentos personales, datos de salud y, en el futuro, el procesamiento de pagos. Para construir la infraestructura de este programa transformador, Buenos Aires se ha asociado con QuarkID, un protocolo de identidad digital de c√≥digo abierto desarrollado por Extrimian, la principal empresa de identidad descentralizada de Am√©rica Latina. QuarkID utiliza zkSync Era como su protocolo ancla, alimentando las billeteras a trav√©s de las cuales los individuos reclamar√°n sus documentos.

‚ÄúEsto marca un salto monumental hacia un futuro m√°s seguro y eficiente para los servicios gubernamentales en Am√©rica Latina‚Äù, afirma Guillermo Villanueva, CEO de Extrimian. ‚ÄúQuarkID fomenta v√≠nculos m√°s estrechos entre los gobiernos y los ciudadanos al mismo tiempo que introduce pr√°cticas de identidad digital y est√°ndares de seguridad en Am√©rica Latina‚Äù.

Los datos almacenados en las billeteras de QuarkID son aut√≥nomos, lo que permite a los ciudadanos controlar la entrega de sus credenciales al interactuar con servicios administrativos. zkSync Era sirve como capa de liquidaci√≥n para QuarkID, asegurando que cada ciudadano participante mantenga la propiedad de sus credenciales leg√≠timas.

Si bien QuarkID hace su debut en Buenos Aires, su arquitectura est√° dise√±ada para escalar globalmente. Cumpliendo con est√°ndares internacionales como W3C, Trust Over IP y Sovrin Foundation, QuarkID es interoperable con redes de todo el mundo.

Aprovechando la Tecnolog√≠a ZK para Empoderar a 650 Millones de Personas en Am√©rica Latina

Si bien la identidad digital basada en blockchain promete un cambio revolucionario en la propiedad de datos, a menudo genera controversia en cuanto a la verdadera descentralizaci√≥n de estos procesos. Eventos recientes, como las preocupaciones del gobierno de Kenia sobre la privacidad de los datos en un proyecto de criptomoneda biom√©trica, resaltan estos problemas.

Sin embargo, la transparencia y la seguridad inherentes a la vanguardia de la tecnolog√≠a de Conocimiento Cero (ZK), combinadas con Ethereum, tienen el potencial de disipar tales preocupaciones. Esta asociaci√≥n desbloquea la aplicaci√≥n de identidad digital preservadora de la privacidad para naciones enteras.

zkSync Era partnership with QuarkID

Source: ZkSync Blog: https://zksync.mirror.xyz/w4_Dyhbx1X2BEGpYNCn8rEAS_2uC1hV0qPQl_m5AChk

 

Con zkSync y Ethereum como columna vertebral de esta iniciativa, los datos personales almacenados en cadena mitigan el robo de identidad y los ataques de informaci√≥n personal com√∫nmente asociados con tecnolog√≠as centralizadas de almacenamiento de datos. zkSync garantiza que la propiedad digital sea confiable, sin necesidad de confianza y segura, al tiempo que prioriza la privacidad.

El gobierno argentino y la Ciudad de Buenos Aires tienen como objetivo establecer su marco de identidad digital como un bien p√∫blico, lo que permite a las personas realizar transacciones de informaci√≥n de manera fluida entre el gobierno, las empresas y sus pares.

Diego Fernandez, Secretario de Innovaci√≥n del Gobierno de la Ciudad de Buenos Aires, enfatiza: ‚ÄúCon este desarrollo, Buenos Aires se convierte en la primera ciudad de Am√©rica Latina y una de las primeras en el mundo en integrar y promover esta nueva tecnolog√≠a y establecer el est√°ndar de c√≥mo otros pa√≠ses de la regi√≥n deber√≠an utilizar la tecnolog√≠a blockchain en beneficio de su gente‚Äù.

Lee esta Nota a Diego Fernandez en Fortune Crypto para conocer m√°s sobre esta alianza y c√≥mo se llevar√° a cabo.

QuarkID protocolo de confianza digital descentralizado, y verificaci√≥n de datos privados

 

Comenzando en octubre, los residentes de Buenos Aires podr√°n descargar una billetera QuarkID para reclamar documentos de identificaci√≥n personal, incluyendo certificados de nacimiento y matrimonio. QuarkID estar√° disponible para todos los ciudadanos argentinos y eventualmente se convertir√° en obligatorio en todo el pa√≠s. En noviembre, documentos como comprobantes de ingresos y verificaciones acad√©micas estar√°n disponibles para obtener en las billeteras de QuarkID. A fines de 2023, el gobierno establecer√° la hoja de ruta futura de QuarkID y delinear√° los hitos de expansi√≥n para brindar inicialmente sus servicios a m√°s de 3 millones de ciudadanos.

Buenos Aires lidera esta iniciativa, marcando el comienzo de una nueva era de Internet a trav√©s de la propiedad digital. Esperamos que las naciones de todo el mundo vean a Argentina como un ejemplo de c√≥mo la identidad Web3 puede prosperar a nivel gubernamental.

Elliptic

UK suffers record number of ransomware attacks: how to detect the money flows

Organizations in the United Kingdom reportedly suffered a record number of ransomware attacks last year, according to analysis of a dataset published by the Information Commissioner‚Äôs Office (ICO).
